intro: Daucus subsessilis, commonly known as the narrowleaf parsley or narrowleaf carrot, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are typically narrow and sessile, giving it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to the western United States and thrives in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
